data.title: Nice hotel close to everything in downtown Glendale.
data.text: This was a nice hotel. They have a nice parking garage, well lit. The rooms are very clean and newly remodeled if the hotel is not new (not sure). The hotel was undergoing some construction when I was there so some delays with elevators and some construction noise. Overall I slept really good for being in a hotel...the beds were actually comfortable (not something I am used to in a hotel). I would come back. If you need anything Target is a short walk!

owner_response.author: Art B, Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear kellis975,

Target is a short walk! The hotel was built brand new from the ground up. We're glad you had an excellent sleep. We cant wait for your return visit. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Worst customer service
data.text: A great bed to sleep in but if you have to interact with staff be prepared to exceed any time limit you may set on that interaction. Simple requests, shampoo, to check in and out, takes much longer than it should

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear laurenbZ6849VZ,

I'm glad you enjoyed the bedding. I agree, simple requests shouldn't take more that 3-5 minutes. I have re-trained our staff to make sure all guest requests are completed in a timely manner. We hope you give us another chance so we can exceed your expectations.

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hampton Inn in Glendale
data.text: I first noticed a sign in the lobby,asking for pardoning the construction for fixing a pipe. I was not prepared to walk through a construction zone once I exited the elevator. The room was nice, spacious, quiet and the bed was comfortable.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear William T,

Thanks for your feedback. I'm happy to say guests can now access all floors with any elevator as the hallway construction is complete. We're glad you enjoyed the room. We hope to see you back very soon.

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Place is under Construction
data.text: Room was dirty.  I had grease fingerprints on the dresser.  The tub was dirty.  Place is under construction and I was not advised when I booked.  Fitness center is closed.  The elevator is not accessible to all the floors in the hotel

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear 234shamekac,

I want to thank you for your feedback. I'm happy to say that we're complete in our 3rd and 4th floor hallways. Guests can now use any elevator to access any floor. The gym is just about complete, but in the meantime we are reimbursing guests who choose to use LA Fitness. It's a few blocks away from us and its an oversized workout facility. We cant wait until you stay with us again. We will make sure your expectations are exceeded.

Thanks,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good hotel
data.text: Glendale is close to La and the nearby shopping at the Galleria is great! This property is new and well maintained.  Definitely a good stay for the value if you are in the area! You will not be disappointed.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thanks for your excellent comments. Our team was really excited when to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. I agree our location is a few steps away from the Glendale Galleria! We hope to see back soon. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great amenities and location
data.text: I enjoy Hampton Inn & Suites and consider it a highly consistent brand that offers superior accommodations and amenities for the price.  This particular location was brand new and still under construction during my stay. Nevertheless, there were no circumstances as a result of the construction that were an inconvenience or a distraction.  I suspect that upon final completion of the hotel, this location will be yet another fine example of Hampton Inn & Suites' product.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear James A,

Thanks for understanding about our construction. Were glad you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to having you return to our property. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hampton Inn & Suites-Glendale, Ca
data.text: The hotel is centrally located across the street from a major mall, restaurants, movie theatre, etc.  The hotel is new and the staff is outstanding. When I stayed there there was a major water leak prior to my arrival and major repairs and construction were underway. The breakfast serving area is rather small and creates a crowded condition while serving yourself but the eating area is large. The rooms were very clean and you could hear very little or no noise from the street. The parking garage is offered at no charge and very convenient to the lobby and rooms. Overall a great hotel although the daily rate is a little higher than most Hilton properties in the area.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Ernest B,

We're excited that you enjoyed our location. Our staff strives to make all guest experiences excellent. Guest room cleanliness is top priority for us. We also do offer Diamond Honors members complimentary parking. We hope to see again very soon in the future. 

Thanks,

Art Bedroussian

General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Stay was a Disaster
data.text: Hotel torn apart and still operating during construction. Poor service and attention to detail by staff.   Would not recommend this hotel until management resolves issues and creates a better guest focused environment.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Corey W,

We apologize your expectations weren't exceeded. We hope you give us another chance to see the changes we've made. Every minute of the day our focus is on building excellent guest journeys. 

Thanks,

Art Bedroussian

General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointing stay at a Hampton Inn & Suites
data.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights last week.  We were unaware of the construction zone until we arrived.  Due to a recent pipe burst there is plastic sheeting and work being done everywhere.  Our room was very large but never got serviced so we returned to the hotel after 10 pm to find nothing done.  Calling down to the Front Desk received an apathetic response.  There is a nice parking garage attached to the hotel but NO security.  We arrived late at night and were able to walk in and take the elevator directly to our floor without needing to use our card.  If I had been traveling alone I would have been very nervous.  Most hotels require your keycard to enter late at night.  When we checked out the Assistant Manager listened to our concerns and indicated that he would put 30,000 Hilton Honors points back into our account for our inconvenience about the housekeeping.  This still has yet to be done.  This hotel is in a great location and the rooms are very nice but I would caution anyone traveling alone to make sure you are in the hotel earlier in the evening until they fix this security problem.  We have been Hilton Honors members for decades and this hotel was very disappointing.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear riley2az,

We apologize for the pipe burst. Your room cleanliness and and the staff response is unacceptable. I have re-trainined the staff to make sure all guests experiences are exceeded. Please rest assured that Glendale, CA is one of the top neighborhoods for safety. As far as the parking garage, I'm happy to say all entrances are gated now. We're also in the process of making all entrances and elevators key access only. Were glad you enjoyed our location. We hope to see back soon so you can see the changes we've made. Your happiness is our #1 priority.

Thanks,

Art Bedroussian

General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Above and beyond professionalism during and opening and i=unexpected pip burst!
data.text:
I stayed at this brand new modern, clean, safe Hampton Inn perfectly located to the Americana grounds, shopping, freeways and beyond in the beautiful Glendale downtown area!

This was a week after their opening and there was an unfortunate pip burst in the building - all were safe but left a very noticeable construction zone throughout many floors including the main entrance BUT especially with this hotel and it's team and contractors under great pressure I was completely impressed by the leadership of their GM, Art and all of his team's positive attitudes, professionalism and the "above and beyond"  approach they all made for each of your guests and the contractors who were all co-habitating and working together.

There was great respect on all sides - they should be proud of rising above this difficult time.

The women working the breakfast were so nice, the food very good and the housekeeping staff, check in staff as well - courteous and friendly!

The rooms are clean and sharp!

Will definitely make this my Glendale home for my many returns and stays in the area for business and pleasure.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Laura S,

Thanks for your feedback. When we read your comments to our staff, they were thrilled. From Breakfast, Housekeeping to Front desk all were smiles when they heard the feedback! It really was a pleasure having you as our guest. Every department couldn't wait to be of assistance. We can't wait to have you as a return Honors member. We will strive to do whatever it takes to make sure you stay at our hotel every time your travels bring you to the Glendale area. I'm glad you enjoyed our location. Thanks for understanding about our water situation. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian

General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: UNDER FULL CONSTRUCTION
data.text: This hotel is a mess!  It is under full construction mode as apparently there was a water main break recently.  Large areas are boarded up and draped off.  This hotel is in a good location, but shouldn't even really be open yet.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Andrea Y,

We apologize for the water main break situation. We want to make sure all guest expectations are exceeded daily. We are hoping you stay with us next time your travels bring you to the Glendale\Los Angeles Area. Our team will make sure you have an excellent journey. We will do whatever it takes to make up for the water situation. Your happiness is our main goal. 

Thanks,

Art Bedroussian

General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Brand new, primo location - would stay here again
data.text:
We stayed here four nights and were impressed with the location, the staff, and the modern style of the property. It's true that the hotel had a broken water pipe just days after they opened in September and they are working hard to repair and restore the property. We had a room on the top floor away from the elevator and we were never inconvenienced by construction noise, street noise, or dust in the room. The manager and every member of the staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs from an early checkin to making and serving the waffles at breakfast. We were offered the opportunity to use a nearby fitness center and be reimbursed for the cost of the day pass if we desired. The property is just across the street from the upscale upscale Americana shopping area and about a block from the adjacent Galleria enclosed mall. There are also numerous dining options in the vicinity, ranging from In and Out to fine dining.

Suggest asking for a room on the top two floors for better views and less street noise. Uneven numbers face Colorado Street with the mountains in the background (attractive retail development in the foreground), higher numbers will be farther from the elevator and icemaker. Modern AC in the rooms with a thermostat and quiet fan (none of the clanking and rattling you sometimes hear with the "window" type units). Pulldown blackout roller shades kept out the street light at night and provided privacy. Plenty of power and USB jacks to charge electronic devices without having to set them on the floor or use extension cords. We did not have a vehicle to park, but it is worth noting that there is a parking charge at this property, something I had not encountered at any other Hampton Inn.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear TNbeachbum75,

We're so happy you enjoyed your stay with us. Our team was excited to read your comments. I agree there's plenty of modern shopping and restaurants near by. We also made sure all areas were compatible with modern technology. We are one of the few modern designed Hampton's in the area. We hope to see you back very soon. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: College visit weekend
data.text: I really like what Hilton is doing with their Hamptons.  I stayed in one in SAN Luis Obispo and it really reminded me of this one.  I liked both of them.  The decor was modern and comfortable.  Only one very minor concern with the entry tile.  There seemed to be a stain on it that I couldn't remove.  I decided it was probably construction related as they are currently remodeling.    Also because of remodeling there was no gym access but staff said you could use a local gym and be reimbursed. It's also in a good location close to the Galleria Mall and plenty of good restaurants.  I would stay here again.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Ferryfe,

Were glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Our gym will be back in a couple weeks. In the meantime there's an LA Fitness in which guests can use and we reimburse them for the daily workout. I agree, the location is 5 stars. We hope to see you back very soon!

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Under construction
data.text: It may actually end up being a great property after the construction finishes. But because of the construction, the fitness room is out of commission, cannot navigate between different wings of the same floor because of hallway closure and having to use the stairs constantly because the only elevator that you have access to could stop working without any notice.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Shripathi K,

Thanks for staying with us. We apologize for the elevators not functioning correctly. We had a city wide power outage that shut down one of the elevators while you were a guest in our hotel. All the finishing touches are being placed in regards to the water leak we encountered. We hope to see you back very soon!

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Welcoming and great location
data.text: Brand new, helpful friendly staff, always like relaxed breakfast to start our day and great location. Shopping, restaurants, sights. Outdoor area, pool and fireplace. Ample parking. Our room was clean, comfortable and television and wi-fi great.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thanks for the feedback! Were glad you enjoyed your stay. Our team members were really excited when I shared your comments with them. We hope you come back very soon. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hotel a disaster
data.text: The hotel is located very well in Glendale CA.  It is supposed to be a brand new hotel - which appealed.  The hotel is either still under construction or they had a VERY BAD leak.  Many sections of the hotel were closed off with plastic. Upon arrival, my room was not ready and I was moved.  In the new room, one of the GFI plugs would not reset and another wouldn't work.  Otherwise it was a nice enough room.  My colleague was on the 4th floor.  She had to go up to the 5th floor and then come back down to the 4th floor because a large section of the 4th floor was closed.  The elevators only worked part of the time.  The lobby was partially enclosed in plastic.  There were fans drying floors everywhere.  The staff was nice enough but when we complained I was offered Hilton points, no credit on the rooms.  We were not the only people complaining.  The fitness center was closed.  The lounge area for breakfast was only partially open.  I cannot believe they took reservations.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Michelle L,

The hotel actually had a water leak. Partial 3rd and 4th floors were being worked on including partial lobby area. Currently all services are available except for the GYM. However there's an LA Fitness a few blocks away in which we are reimbursing guests for daily passes. We truly hope you give us another chance so we can exceed your expectations. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lots of construction
data.text: Stayed here for family fun at Universal Studios just 20 min away. If we had known this hotel was under construction we would have chosen another place to stay. Elevators were heavily used by cleaning crew or construction crew and we had to take the stairs several times or wait a long time. Enclosed parking area next to the elevators was minimal. Our room faced Colorado Street and was very noisy at night with heavy traffic into late night and very early before 5:00 am. Room was clean and appeared remodeled. Staff was friendly. Breakfast was good. Wait for construction to be completed, it will probably be better then.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Cat_Travels2000,

Thanks for your feedback. We actually had a water leak in our hotel. We apologize for the noise in the early morning. We hope your back soon, so our staff can exceed your expectations. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not a good experience
data.text: No elevators working most of the time, no electricity on final night! Only got to the breakfast one time due to elevators not working. I don't think I will be back to this location but I might once all the kinks are worked out.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear B5329ZOtereal,

We apologize that there was no electricity on your final night. We had a city wide power outage which caused the elevator to stop working. We hope you give us another chance soon so you can see the changes we've made. We will make sure to exceed your expectations. 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great experience
data.text: Great location. Lots of parking. Great rooms. Friendly and accommodating staff. I stayed here shortly after they opened, and, unfortunately, had just experienced a main water line break--which closed down half of the hotel. The staff did everything in their power to make my stay enjoyable. I consistently heard "we are sorry for the inconvenience, but want to do everything we can to still exceed your expectations." They succeeded. I feel saddened that their rating has gone down due to the water issue, which was no fault of their own. I will not hesitate to stay here again when I am in east LA.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Dana C.,

Thanks for your understanding. We hope to you back soon! 

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New Hotel and Perfect Location
data.text: The hotel had only been open two weeks and it was obvious that all the employees were doing their best at their jobs and were very friendly and anxious to make us feel welcome.  It is located directly across the street from the Americana and the Glendale Galleria so we could walk everywhere.  The accommodations were very comfortable and clean. There are currently air blowers throughout the hotel to dry a water leak; they did not impact our visit in any way.

owner_response.author: Art B, General Manager at Hampton Inn & Suites Los Angeles - Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Laurel O,

Were so glad you enjoyed your stay! Indeed we are a few steps to Americana and Glendale Galleria. We hope to remove the blowers very soon. We can't wait until your return visit with us!

Sincerely,

Art Bedroussian
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response
